lines.text: Well, you know that candle the wizard’s holding?
If you look at those melty candles on the floor, you’ll see there’s four of them, right?
But more importantly, the wicks aren’t black- they’ve never been lit!
That fifth candle- one for each point of the star on the table, I bet- had to be on fire at some point.
If the other candles melted without burning, that means this one was probably lit recently.
And since the wizard’s holding the only recent source of fire, he’s probably the one who started it!
...I don’t know. There’s a lot of other possible explanations, so we should keep our eyes open.
For now, though, we’ll run with that and see where it takes us.
That said, even if we know why there was a source of fire in the first place…
There was one heck of a blaze going on, to leave a pile of ashes like that. <c=#FF00FF>What caught fire,</c> and how did it spread?
Let me get back to you on that.
Hm... well, there's a bunch of what used to be candles on the floor, there.
Could be they set something on fire when they fell?
I don't think so. Isn't there something about that evidence that disproves that?
Oh- right, the wicks. They're white, never been lit.
It might still be a <c=#FF00FF>candle,</c> but not these.
